version_description: General improvements of user interface and performance.
General improvements of user interface and performance.
General improvements of user interface and performance.

- The [Live from PlayStation] feature has been added.
- Playback of video in notifications from PS Store is now supported. These notifications appear under [What's New].
- This app will no longer automatically connect to a PS4™ system that is in standby mode.
- Stability has been improved.

- The [Live from PlayStation] feature has been added.
- Playback of video in notifications from PS Store is now supported. These notifications appear under [What's New].
- This app will no longer automatically connect to a PS4™ system that is in standby mode.
- Stability has been improved.

- The [Live from PlayStation] feature has been added.
- Playback of video in notifications from PS Store is now supported. These notifications appear under [What's New].
- This app will no longer automatically connect to a PS4™ system that is in standby mode.
- Stability has been improved.
This application has been updated.

General improvements of user interface and performance
General improvements of user interface and performance
General improvements of user interface and performance

- Notification alerts are now supported.
- Thumbnails are now displayed for screenshots and video clips that are posted to Twitter or Facebook® as activities. (To use this feature, you must have a Twitter or Facebook account.)
- Resolutions for iPad 2 and iPad mini are now supported.
- Pictures you take on your iPad, iPhone, or iPod touch can now be set as your profile picture.
- You can now send a PSN℠ Friend request to your friend using email or text.
- Stability during use of some features has been improved.
* Twitter is a trademark or registered trademark of Twitter, Inc.
* Facebook is a trademark or registered trademark of Facebook, Inc.
* iPad, iPad mini, iPhone, and iPod touch are trademarks of Apple Inc.

- The home screen has been redesigned.
- Tablet layout is now supported.
- [Players You May Know] will now appear on your Friends list.
- You can now create a link for your Friend request and share it with other people.
- You can now search for other players using their real names.

- The home screen has been redesigned.
- Tablet layout is now supported.
- [Players You May Know] will now appear on your Friends list.
- You can now create a link for your Friend request and share it with other people.
- You can now search for other players using their real names.

- The home screen has been redesigned.
- Tablet layout is now supported.
- [Players You May Know] will now appear on your Friends list.
- You can now create a link for your Friend request and share it with other people.
- You can now search for other players using their real names.

-The home screen has been redesigned.
-[Accessibility] has been added to [Settings]. You can adjust accessibility settings such as text size and high contrast.
-VoiceOver for iOS is now supported.
-You can now delete trophies with 0% achievement progress.
-[Earned Date], [Not Earned], and [Grade] have been added as sorting options for trophies. You can also sort by [Earned Date] and [Not Earned] options when comparing trophies with other players.
-You can now sort content in [Live from PlayStation]. You can sort by [Number of Spectators], [Date], or [Number of Comments]. If [Games] is selected, you can also sort by [Number of Broadcasters] or [Game Title].
-[Privacy Settings] has been added to [Profile].
-You can now send real-name requests in addition to Friend requests to users who are currently not on your Friends list.
-The name and icon for "PSN(SM)" have been changed to "PlayStation™Network".

- PlayStation™Network Card numbers and promotion codes can now be entered within PlayStation®App.
- Comments that you receive while broadcasting from your PS4™ system can now be displayed on the second screen.

- PlayStation™Network Card numbers and promotion codes can now be entered within PlayStation®App.
- Comments that you receive while broadcasting from your PS4™ system can now be displayed on the second screen.

- PlayStation™Network Card numbers and promotion codes can now be entered within PlayStation®App.
- Comments that you receive while broadcasting from your PS4™ system can now be displayed on the second screen.

- [Events] has been added. All events associated with PlayStation® are now brought together, enabling you to discover and participate in these events in a centralized area.
- You can now use PlayStation®App to easily log in as a guest to the PS4™ system.
- You can now send a request to watch another user's gameplay.
- You can now comment on activities.
- YouTube™ broadcasts are now displayed in [Live from PlayStation].

- You can now follow verified accounts. When you follow the accounts, you can keep track of their activities in [What's New].
- The message feature in PlayStation®App is now available as a separate application. You must install the [PlayStation®Messages] application to continue using the message feature.

We have a new update for you. Here’s what’s in it:
- The shortcut has been renamed “PS App”.
- There are more mobile notifications to help you stay up to date.
- An issue that prevented PayPal users from completing purchases has been fixed.
- You can now follow anyone, not just verified accounts.
- [Feedback] has been added under [Settings], so you can help us improve this app.
- The following languages are now partially supported: Czech, Greek, Hungarian, Indonesian, Romanian, Thai, Vietnamese
- Other fixes and performance improvements.

Our latest update is ready. Here's what's in it:
- Landscape orientation is now supported on iPad. Thanks for your patience.
- Customize your profile with a cover image and color.
- The [Games] section in your profile now shows which of your Friends play each game.
- Post photos from your phone for your Friends to see in What's New.
- This update also includes fixes and performance improvements.

- See when your Friends were last online.

A brand-new PlayStation App!

We’ve combined the previous PlayStation App and PlayStation Messages into one seamless experience – packing in lots of new features so you can easily connect with friends while keeping up with the latest deals and gaming news.

For family managers and guardians: When your child wants to play restricted games on their PS5, or when they want to use communication features on either their PS5 or PS4, you'll get a notification. Tap the notification to view details and approve the request.

• Watch your friend's PS5 gameplay using Share Screen: Simply tap on their Share Screen from your shared voice chat.

• Game Base: Voice chats are now called Parties. Open parties allow your friends and friends of party members to join without an invite, while closed parties are only for players you invite.
• PS5 Captures: Share your game captures from PS5. This feature releases in supported countries/regions first, with more added soon.
